column5:
About the programme
             

              A master's degree opens doors in many different branches and sectors. You'll be able to work in the private sector, (non-)governmental organisations, or continue your academic career as a PhD researcher. As an educational scientist, you can take a leading or advising role in educational offices for the government, an NGO, a company, or institutions for higher education. Here, you'll use your management and research skills and apply your theoretical and professional knowledge. The master's degree in educational sciences is a specialised programme and contains no further specialisations. The programme consists of compulsory and elective courses. The strenghts of our  Educational Sciences master's programme:
